Database

Database interface that all DBD’s must inherit from

Summary
Database
Database interface that all DBD’s must inherit from
Functions
connect
Connect to a database.
close
Close the database connection.
execute
Execute a SQL statement that returns no results.
prepare
Prepare a SQL statement for execution.
query
Query the database.
queryFetchOne
Query the database and return only the first row.
queryFetchAll
Query the database and return an array of all the rows.
getErrorCode
Get the error code.
getErrorMessage
Get the error message.

Functions

connect

Connect to a database.

Paramters

char[] connconnection string
char[] userusername
char[] passwdpassword

Notes

user and passwd are not always used.  If not supplied, they default to null.

close

Close the database connection.

execute

Execute a SQL statement that returns no results.

Parameters

char[] sqlSQL statement to execute

prepare

Prepare a SQL statement for execution.

Parameters

char[] sqlSQL statement to execute

query

Query the database.

Parameters

char[] sqlSQL statement to execute

queryFetchOne

Query the database and return only the first row.

Parameters

char[] sqlSQL statement to execute

queryFetchAll

Query the database and return an array of all the rows.

Parameters

char[] sqlSQL statement to execute

getErrorCode

Get the error code.

Todo

This function needs some thought.  Should we wrap common SQL errors into a “D DBI” error code so that ALL DBD’s report the same information?  That’s the way I am currently leaning.  Any input?
